project.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc
project.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (=a small trial to test if an idea will be successful).
The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
a project to develop a substitute for oil
project.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a part of a school or college course that involves careful study of a particular subject over a period of time
project.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: We’re doing a project on pollution.
project.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The aim of this research project is to study modern food habits.
Spending on new construction projects has been reduced.
Our aim is assess the environmental impact of new development projects.
These changes were shelved after pilot projects showed poor results.
The company is funding a major research project into the causes of addiction.
Young people often enjoy the challenge of an ambitious project.
A team has been working on the project for three years.
I am involved in various projects.
$30 million would be required to set up the project.
He was embarking on the biggest project of his career.
The project was completed on time.
The project manager is responsible for sorting this out.
The first phase of the project was due to be completed by the end of 2008.
project.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to calculate what something will be in the future, using the information you have now
project.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The company projected an annual growth rate of 3%.
Total expenditure is projected to rise by 25%.
project.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to stick out beyond an edge or surface
project.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Four towers projected from the main building.
project.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to make the picture of a film, photograph etc appear in a larger form on a screen or flat surface
project.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: She projected the slide onto the wall.
project.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to try to make other people have a particular idea about you
project.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: I hope the team will project a smart professional image.
his attempts to project himself as a potential leader
project.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to make something move up or forwards with great force
project.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: The plant projects its seeds over a wide area.
project.translation[1].definitions[5].de: to make someone quickly have success or a much better job
project.translation[1].definitions[5].ex: His success projected him onto Channel 4‘s comedy series ’Packet of Three'.
project.translation[1].definitions[6].de: to imagine that someone else is feeling the same emotions as you
project.translation[1].definitions[6].ex: You’re projecting your insecurity onto me.
project.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an important and carefully planned piece of work that will create something new or improve a situation
project.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: San Miguel plans to finance the project 42% from equity and 58% from loans.
The project is scheduled to be completed in early 2009.
project.translation[2].definitions[1].de: money needed for a large building project, usually in the form of investment loans
project.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Olympia & York Developments Ltd. is negotiating long-term project financing for its Canary Wharf development in London.
project.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to calculate what the size, amount, or rate of something will be in the future
project.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: California Microwave dropped 2 points after itprojected earnings of 19 cents a share for the third quarter.
Sources said that privately the company is projecting a bigger decline.
